---
title: "Lectures Scientific and Statistical Reasoning"
---

Below you can find the links to my current lecture slides for Scientific and Statistical Reasoning. The source code can be found at the [GitHub repository](https://github.com/ShKlinkenberg/statistics-lectures). 

```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# install.packages("rvest")
library(rvest)

rm(list = ls())
lectures <- list.files(path = "courses/current", pattern = "*handout.html", recursive = T, full.names = TRUE)

n <- length(lectures)

lectures.names = vector()
lectures.dates = vector()
lectures.links = vector()
slides.links   = vector()

for(i in 1:n) {

lecture_html <- read_html(lectures[i])

lectures.names[i] <- lecture_html %>% html_nodes(".title") %>% html_text()
lectures.dates[i] <- lecture_html %>% html_nodes(".date") %>% html_text()
lectures.links[i] <- paste0('<a href="https://shklinkenberg.github.io/statistics-lectures/',
                            lectures[i],
                            '" target="_blank">',
                            'handout',
                            '</a>')
slides.links[i]  <- gsub("_handout", "_IOslides", lectures.links[i])
slides.links[i]  <- gsub("handout", "slide", slides.links[i])
}

#links <- sprintf('topics/%s', topics)


# links <- sprintf('<a href="https://shklinkenberg.github.io/statistics-lectures/courses/current/%s" target="_blank">%s</a>', lectures, lectures.names)

table1 <- data.frame(data    = lectures.dates, 
                     lecture = lectures.names,
                     slides  = slides.links,
                     handout = lectures.links)
```
